title: NASA preparing for Orion splashdown to conclude Artemis 1
summary: NASA’s Orion spacecraft is in the home stretch of the Artemis 1 uncrewed test flight as the agency prepares for the vehicle’s ultimate test: reentry and splashdown in the Pacific Ocean.

title: Rocket Report: Starship flight test slips to 2023; first methane launch is imminent
summary: "We need some adult supervision there to actually help these guys."

title: China launches 14 satellites with new solid rocket from mobile sea platform
summary: China launched its new Jielong-3 rocket from a mobile sea platform in the Yellow Sea Friday, successfully sending 14 satellites into orbit.

title: SpaceX requests permission for direct-to-smartphone service
summary: SpaceX could provide “full and continuous” direct-to-smartphone services across much of the globe with less than a third of the 7,500 Gen 2 Starlink satellites approved last week, the company said in a request to add the capability to the broadband constellation.

title: Michigan Students to Hear from Current NASA Space Station Astronaut
summary: Students in Charlevoix, Michigan, will have an opportunity next week to hear from a NASA astronaut living and working aboard the International Space Station.
